intro: Gliopsis burchellii, commonly known as the African thornapple, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its spiny stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by spherical, fleshy fruits. Its latex contains toxic compounds, making it potentially harmful to animals and humans. Gliopsis burchellii is often found in rocky or sandy soils in arid and semi-arid regions.
